Tertibkan Tambang Ilegal, Kendaraan Dinas Pemprov Bangka Belitung Dirusak
02 Nov 2019, 23:02 by Tim detikcom
Bangka Belitung - Wakil Gubernur Provinsi Kepulauan Bangka Belitung Abdul Fatah melakukan penertiban tambang timah ilegal di Kabupaten Belitung, Bangka Belitung. Dalam penertiban tersebut, kendaraan operasional milik Abdul Fatah dan Satpol PP dirusak oleh orang tak dikenal.
Dilansir dari Antara, ada delapan kendaraan mobil dinas yang dirusak oleh oknum tersebut, Sabtu (2/11/2019). Sempat terjadi bentrokan dalam penertiban kepada penambang ilegal.
"Penertiban tersebut memicu emosi sehingga melakukan tindakan anarkis dan perlawanan terhadap petugas," kata Kapolres Belitung AKBP Yudhis Wibisana.
Yudhis mengatakan sebanyak 20 anggota Satpol PP Bangka Belitung juga menjadi korban dari bentrokan tersebut. Tujuh orang di antaranya mendapatkan perawatan di RSUD Marsidi Judono Belitung.
"Kemudian ada kerugian berupa penrusakan dan pembakaran terhadap kendaraan dinas sebanyak delapan unit," tutur Yudhis.
Dia mengatakan sempat menerima laporan ada penyanderaan kepada Abdul Fatah. Polres Belitung memberikan bantuan kepada Pemprov dalam melakukan penertiban tersebut dan memastikan tidak ada penganiayaan kepada Abdul Fatah.
"Alhamdulillah Wakil Gubernur Abdul Fatah tidak ada dipukul dan tidak ada diperlakukan keras oleh penambang biji timah atau masyarakat dalam insiden itu," tutur Yudhis.

Regulate Illegal Mining, Vehicle of the Bangka Belitung Provincial Government was Damaged
02 Nov 2019, 23:02 by Tim detikcom
Bangka Belitung - Deputy Governor of the Bangka Belitung Islands Province Abdul Fatah conducted an illegal tin mining operation in Belitung Regency, Bangka Belitung. In controlling this, operational vehicles owned by Abdul Fatah and Satpol PP were damaged by unknown persons.
Reporting from Antara, there were eight official vehicle vehicles that were damaged by the person on Saturday (11/02/2019). There was a clash in control of illegal miners.
"The control triggers emotions so that they act anarchistly and fight against officers," said Belitung Police Chief AKBP Yudhis Wibisana.
Yudhis said as many as 20 Satpol PP Bangka Belitung members were also victims of the clash. Seven of them received treatment at Marsidi Judono Belitung Hospital.
"Then there were losses in the form of destruction and burning of eight official vehicles," said Yudhis.
He said he had received reports of a hostage taking to Abdul Fatah. The Belitung Regional Police gave assistance to the Provincial Government in carrying out the control and ensured that there was no persecution of Abdul Fatah.
"Alhamdulillah, Deputy Governor Abdul Fatah was not beaten and no one was harshly treated by tin ore miners or the community in the incident," Yudhis said.
